## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I have a few questions about executing transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace. How do you execute transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace through a centralized intermediary?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, you don't need a centralized intermediary at all. On the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, transactions are executed in a completely decentralized way, directly peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. You can buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see.

**User:**
That sounds really interesting. I have another question. Is it possible to spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault?

**AI Assistant:**
No, it is not possible to spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault. If you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so.

**User:**
Got it! And one more question. Do you need multiple IDs to enable revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you don't need multiple IDs. You need at least one primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured to enable revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities.
How do you execute transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace through a centralized intermediary?

You don't. On the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, transactions are executed in a completely decentralized way, directly peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. You can buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.
Is it possible to spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault?

No, it is not possible to spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault. If you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so.
